children.name: Airports
children.description: Signage located throughout terminals in arrival and departure areas, ticketing areas, baggage claim, gate-hold rooms, concourses, retail shops, and VIP lounges.

children.name: Arrival Hall
children.description: Locations for meeting passengers arriving on flights

children.name: Baggage Claim
children.description: Locations to retrieve baggage not carried during a flight

children.name: Departures Hall
children.description: Location for dropping off passengers leaving on flights

children.name: Food Court
children.description: Location within an airport for food, typically casual

children.name: Gates
children.description: Location to wait for or embark or disembark from a specific plane

children.name: Lounges
children.description: (typically private) places to wait for flights, separate from public spaces

children.name: Shopping Area
children.description: Retail areas contained within facilities primarily used for servicing flights

children.name: Buses
children.description: Displays located on or in city or intercity buses.

children.name: Bus (Inside)
children.description: Advertising inside a bus, primarily visible to bus passengers

children.name: Terminal
children.description: Advertising at facilities for embarking or disembarking from a bus

children.name: Bus (Outside)
children.description: Advertising outside a bus, primarily visible to people not riding the bus

children.name: Taxi & Rideshare TV
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside taxis and rideshare vehicles visible to passengers in the back seat.

children.name: Taxi & Rideshare Top
children.description: Advertising displays placed on top of taxi and rideshare vehicles visible to nearby pedestrian and drivers.

children.name: Subway
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside subway trains or inside stations or on subway platforms.

children.name: Subway Train
children.description: A (typical municipal area) train that travels primarily underground

children.name: Platform
children.description: Areas to wait for, board, or unboard a subway

children.name: Train Stations
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside train stations or on platforms.

children.name: Train
children.description: A train that travels primarily above ground, on rails

children.name: Platform
children.description: Areas to wait for, board, or unboard a train

children.name: Ferry
children.description: Advertising displays placed inside a passenger water transport.

children.name: Fueling Stations
children.description: An establishment beside a road selling fuel for motor vehicles.

children.name: Fuel Dispenser
children.description: A (typically self-service) device for dispensing fuel to vehicles.

children.name: Shop
children.description: A store attached to a location who's primary audience is people fueling vehicles

children.name: Convenience Stores
children.description: A store with extended opening hours and in a convenient location, stocking a limited range of household goods and groceries.

children.name: Grocery
children.description: A retail shop that primarily sells food, either fresh or preserved.

children.name: Shop Entrance
children.description: Areas near the entrance to a store, often (but not always) visible from outside

children.name: Check Out
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to paying for purchased goods

children.name: Aisles
children.description: Areas primarily dedicated to the display or retrieval of goods

children.name: Liquor Stores
children.description: A retail shop that predominantly sells prepackaged alcoholic beverages, typically in bottles, intended to be consumed off the storeâ€™s premises.

children.name: Mall
children.description: A large building or series of connected buildings containing a variety of retail stores and typically also restaurants.

children.name: Concourse
children.description: A large open area (including hallways and escalators)

children.name: Food Court
children.description: A Common area with multiple food vendors and common tables.

children.name: Spectacular
children.description: Large and impactful screen(s) at a prime location. It often utilizes special embellishments.

children.name: Cannabis Dispensaries
children.description: A store that sells and dispenses cannabis and CBD products.

children.name: Pharmacies
children.description: A store where medicinal drugs are dispensed and sold.

children.name: Parking Garages
children.description: A building in which people usually pay to park their cars, trucks and other vehicles.

children.name: Billboards
children.description: Located primarily on major roads, they attract high-density consumer exposure (mostly to vehicular traffic, but often to pedestrians).

children.name: Roadside
children.description: Primarily vehicular environments.

children.name: Highway
children.description: High-speed vehicular environments, typically with controlled entrance/exit (e.g. "exits" or "interchanges")

children.name: Spectacular
children.description: A bulletin that is usually larger than 14â€™ x 48â€™ and is positioned at a prime location in a market. A spectacular often utilizes special embellishments.

children.name: Urban Panels
children.description: Digital screens in urban environments, typically providing a public amenity. Typically visible to pedestrians and in some cases, vehicular traffic as well.

children.name: Bus Shelters
children.description: Enclosures where individuals may wait for buses in an urban environment. Signage may be attached to the interior or exterior of the enclosure.

children.name: Gyms
children.description: A club, building, or large room, usually containing special equipment, where people go to do physical exercise and get fit.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Area for waiting or meeting guests

children.name: Fitness Equipment
children.description: Area primarily for exercise or the usage of fitness equipment

children.name: Salons
children.description: An establishment where a hairdresser, beautician, or couturier conducts business.

children.name: Unisex Salon
children.description: Salon catering to clients of any sex

children.name: Men's Salon
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards men

children.name: Women's Salon
children.description: Salon primarily catering towards women

children.name: Spas
children.description: A commercial establishment offering health and beauty treatment through such means as steam baths, exercise equipment, and massage.

children.name: Doctorâ€™s Offices
children.description: Non-hospital facility run by a physician - for treatment of people.

children.name: Veterinary Offices
children.description: Non-hopsital facility run by a veterinarian - for treatment of animals.

children.name: Schools
children.description: An educational institution designed to provide learning spaces and learning environments for the teaching of students between K - 12 under the direction of teachers.

children.name: Colleges and Universities
children.description: An education institution designed for instruction, examination, or both, of students in many branches of advanced learning, conferring degrees in various faculties, and often embodying colleges and similar institutions.

children.name: Residences
children.description: Places where faculty or students live

children.name: Common Areas
children.description: Shared spaces for study, dining, or leisure activities

children.name: Athletic Facilities
children.description: Facillities or stadiums for sporting competition

children.name: Office Buildings
children.description: An office building, also known as an office block or business center is a form of commercial building which contains spaces mainly designed to be used for offices. Advertising displays may be in building lobbies, common areas, or in elevators.

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Enclosed, Vertical conveyance for people and goods

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Common space for tenants to meet and greet visitors and guests, typically near entrances

children.name: Recreational Locations
children.description: Location where recreational and/or leisure activities take place.

children.name: Theme Parks
children.description: An amusement park with a unifying setting or idea.

children.name: Museums and Galleries
children.description: A building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited. e.g. "the Museum of Modern Art"

children.name: Concert Venues
children.description: Any location used for a concert or musical performance

children.name: Movie Theaters
children.description: Location for displaying long-format content on large screens.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: A corridor or hall connected with a larger room or series of rooms and used as a passageway or waiting room: such as a large hall serving as a foyer (as of a hotel or theater)

children.name: Food Court
children.description: An area within a building (such as a shopping mall) set apart for food concessions.

children.name: Sports Entertainment
children.description: A venue that individuals or groups can play an active sport or activity.

children.name: Sport Arena
children.description: A central area used for sports or other forms of entertainment and surrounded by seats for spectators.

children.name: Club House
children.description: Locker rooms used by an athletic team

children.name: Bars
children.description: A retail business that serves alcoholic beverages.

children.name: Casual Dining
children.description: A restaurant that serves moderately priced food in a casual atmosphere.

children.name: QSR
children.description: A fast food restaurant, also known as a quick service restaurant within the industry, is a specific type of restaurant that serves fast-food cuisine and has minimal table service.

children.name: Hotels
children.description: An establishment providing accommodations, means, and other services for travelers and tourists.

children.name: Lobby
children.description: Commonly accessible shared spaces for guests at a hotel

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Commonly accessible, enclosed spaces used to move between floors.

children.name: Room
children.description: Locations occupied and restricted to a single guest

children.name: Golf Carts
children.description: A small motorized vehicle for golfers and their equipment.

children.name: Night Clubs
children.description: An establishment for nighttime entertainment, typically serving drinks and offering music, dancing, etc.

children.name: High-End Dining
children.description: A restaurant that serves expensive food. Often in a more formal atmosphere, and accepting or requiring reservations

children.name: DMVs
children.description: An office building, also known as an office block or business center is a form of commercial building which contains spaces mainly designed to be used for offices. Advertising displays may be in building lobbies, common areas, or in elevators.

children.name: Military Bases
children.description: A facility that houses and facilitates training for military personnel and operations.

children.name: Post Offices
children.description: A facility that handles the receipt, delivery, and processing of mail, packages, or other postal services.

children.name: Banks
children.description: A bank is a financial institution licensed to store or invest accountholders money

children.name: Apartment Buildings and Condominiums
children.description: A building that contains different residential units

children.name: Lobby
children.description: A corridor or hall connected with a larger room or series of rooms and used as a passageway or waiting room: such as a large hall serving as a foyer (as of a hotel or theater)

children.name: Elevator
children.description: Enclosed, Vertical conveyance for people and goods
